block.p: Melinda Morrell Hough and Jon Scott Sims were married yesterday by the Rev. Leslie C. Smith at Trinity Episcopal Church in Princeton, N.J.

Mrs. Sims, 27, is an associate at Andrews & Kurth, a law firm in Houston. She graduated from Princeton University and received a law degree from the College of William and Mary. She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard R. Hough of Roanoke, Va. Her father is a senior consultant at American Management Services, a financial consulting company in Waltham, Mass.
Melinda Morrell Hough and Jon Scott Sims were married yesterday by the Rev. Leslie C. Smith at Trinity Episcopal Church in Princeton, N.J.

Mrs. Sims, 27, is an associate at Andrews & Kurth, a law firm in Houston. She graduated from Princeton University and received a law degree from the College of William and Mary. She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard R. Hough of Roanoke, Va. Her father is a senior consultant at American Management Services, a financial consulting company in Waltham, Mass.

Mr. Sims, 33, is known as Scott. He is the director of strategy at Agillion, a company in Austin, Tex., that provides Web-based customer management software to businesses. He graduated cum laude from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. from Harvard. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nelson M. Sims of Indianapolis. His father is the executive director for strategic alliances at Eli Lilly & Company in Indianapolis; until last year, he was the president of Lilly's Canadian affiliate.
